verses.kjv: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.
verses.ct: A person who isolates himself pursues his own desires and rebels against all sound judgment.

verses.kjv: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
verses.ct: A fool has no interest in understanding — they only want to express their own opinions.

verses.kjv: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.
verses.ct: When wickedness arrives, contempt follows right behind, and disgrace brings along shame.

verses.kjv: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
verses.ct: A person's words can be as deep as the ocean, but the source of wisdom is like a fresh, flowing stream.

verses.kjv: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
verses.ct: It is wrong to show favoritism to the guilty and deny justice to the innocent.

verses.kjv: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.
verses.ct: A fool's words drag him into arguments, and his mouth invites a beating.

verses.kjv: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.
verses.ct: A fool's mouth leads to his ruin, and his own words become a trap for his soul.

verses.kjv: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
verses.ct: The words of a gossip are like tasty morsels — they sink deep into a person's core.

verses.kjv: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
verses.ct: Someone who is lazy at their work is no different from someone who destroys everything.

verses.kjv: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
verses.ct: The name of the LORD is a fortified tower — the righteous run to it and find safety.

verses.kjv: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.
verses.ct: A wealthy person's riches are like a fortified city — in their own imagination, they are like a high wall of protection.

verses.kjv: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.
verses.ct: Pride fills a person's heart before their downfall, but humility comes before honor.

verses.kjv: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.
verses.ct: Answering someone before you've heard them out — that is both foolish and embarrassing.

verses.kjv: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
verses.ct: A person's spirit can carry them through illness, but a crushed spirit — who can endure that?

verses.kjv: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
verses.ct: An intelligent mind acquires knowledge, and a wise person's ear is always searching for it.

verses.kjv: A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.
verses.ct: A gift opens doors for a person and gains them access to important people.

verses.kjv: He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.
verses.ct: The first person to present their case always sounds right — until someone else steps in and cross-examines them.

verses.kjv: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
verses.ct: Casting lots settles disputes and resolves conflicts even between powerful people.

verses.kjv: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.
verses.ct: A brother who has been wronged is harder to win back than a fortified city, and such quarrels are like the locked gates of a fortress.

verses.kjv: A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.
verses.ct: What a person says will determine what fills their life — the harvest of their words is what they will live on.

verses.kjv: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
verses.ct: The tongue holds the power of death and life, and those who love to use it will experience its consequences.

verses.kjv: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.
verses.ct: Whoever finds a wife finds something wonderful and receives favor from the LORD.

verses.kjv: The poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.
verses.ct: The poor person pleads for mercy, but the rich person responds harshly.

verses.kjv: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
verses.ct: A person with many companions may be ruined by them, but there is a friend who stays closer than a brother.
